description: wonderful roguelike dungeon-crawler character builder RPG
Obviously the graphics are very simplistic but that's part of the genre. The world is very detailed and so is the class system. If you give it a chance you'll love it!
Had a lot of fun playing this one. Sure it's not WoW standards but its free and it's been made well. Mechanics are good and balanced.

In short: meh story, bad graphics, but great combat balance and intricacy that is very rewarding but nonetheless comes with a somewhat-high learning curve. 

The story is a bit meh - you are an adventurer trying to make sense of a low-tech world that is somehow very widely literate to the point that even trolls write poetry. This creates a good bit of lore text, but all it really attains is being somewhat amusing. 

The graphics are bad and they never get better. Some mobs look kind of neat if you can get past the mid-1990's quality. 

The real driver of this game is combat. It is surprisingly intricate and hard, even on the easy setting. Much of the game revolves around the player learning to use walls and talents to stack fights to their advantage. Just running and stabbing things to death might work for a bit, but it will get you killed sooner or later. Each class has a viable means of overcoming various challenges at every level in the game. Only a handful of "levels" or areas in the entire world are not potentially deadly combat zones. As such, the game requires the player to be constantly diligent. Often, the player will have to run away from a fight just to enter it again through a different corridor or using a different strategy. New players often die a lot and it is easy to get frustrated, but there is a dedicated, small community of fans that run a wiki site and there is an official website too that has statistics for this game for those who want to learn how those intimately aware of the game play it. 

Again, this is a hard game, and if you happen to be a monster and pick it up easily you can unlock a few even harder difficulty settings, the last of which seems impossible to win legitimately if one looks at the game statistics available on the official website. This is a guaranteed challenge with high replayability for those who are willing to waive its less polished bits.
Hard beyond imagining, great storyline and thoughful programming makes me come back to this again and again. I also bought it on Steam to support the dev.
It's great to have a turn-based game so I can stop when need be. Also, one of the prettier roguelikes I've played.
the systems are great, its fun and works as intended

A great game. Endless hours of fun. It's free but also includes paid expansions if you manage to tap out the game's potential. New classes and races are unlocked by completing quests or finding unique items. The graphics, however mediocre they might seem, are an excellent touch to the game giving us something to look at besides text describing the combat events. Equipment dymanically changes the characters look.

The game is a bit more forgiving than other roguelikes with the option of using multiple lives or a single life, as well as including a difficulty option.

Tales of Maj'Eyal brings everything you didn't know you wanted from a roguelike. This includes a great UI where the character may be controlled entirely from the keyboard or mouse. Quickly moving around and exploring is a breeze compared to other roguelikes. Simply clicking on terrain with the mouse will guide the character to that location. This can even be done using the mini-map.

Give it a chance and you'll love it. It's also a great introduction into roguelikes.
summary: Well made fully featured roguelike with snazzy graphics

description:
Bei der Musik haben sie keinen Halt gemacht!!
Es ist wirklich sehr ein spannedes role-playing-game, warum nicht fünf Sterne:

Das Problem ist, dass wenn man stirbt, dann gelangt man zum Tod oder man stirbt für IMMER. Nicht einfach den Nutzer die Items verlieren lassen? Und irgend eine "Strafe", anstatt dass der Spieler wieder von vorne anfangen muss. Auch ist es so, dass man als Magier wegen fast keinem Schaden nicht sehr weit kommt... Der Golem ist das einzige, der mit geholfen hat..

Und sehr dumm ist, dass man die "Controls" nicht erklärt bekommt... Natürlich gibt es eine nette "Community".. Man muss einen Nutzer erstellen. Dann kann man mit "spacebar - Leertaste" in den Chat schreiben und bekommt sofort antwort - wenn jemand Zeit für dich hat, was bei mir für 97% der Fall war etwa!!
Very good RPG style game with many options for the players to choose. Sometimes the balancing is a bit difficult.
xd el maincra es muy bueno , viva vegettita y willyrex :D
Les amateurs du genre l'apprécieront certainement. De quoi passer de bons moments. Bons graphismes, belle musique. Mais pas pour les amateurs de KTA (Kill Them All) pur et dur.
C'est très joliment fait. Le gameplay est cependant délicat. Pour un roguelike, on ne maîtrise pas grand-chose (comparaison des équipements,...)
Да простят меня фанаты nethack, но это - лучший рогалик.
